bill_title: restrict certain paid political advertising on radio and television.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to restrict certain paid political advertising on radio and television. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. No owner, licensee, or operator of any radio, television, or cable television broadcasting station, network, or system, nor any agent or employee of such owner, licensee, or operator, may sell to any candidate, person representing any candidate, or any interest group advocating the election or defeat of any candidate, any advertising time for broadcast between June fifteenth and August thirtieth of each even-numbered year of any paid political advertisement soliciting the public to favor or disfavor the election or defeat of any candidate at the next South Dakota general election. Section 2. No owner, licensee, or operator of any radio, television, or cable television broadcasting station, network, or system, nor any agent or employee of such owner, licensee, or operator, may sell to any candidate, person representing any candidate, or any interest group advocating the election or defeat of any candidate, any advertising time for broadcast between January fifteenth and March thirtieth of each even-numbered year of any paid political advertisement soliciting the public to favor or disfavor the election or defeat of any candidate at the next South Dakota primary election. Section 3. The entire proceeds from any sale of advertising made in violation of the provisions of sections 1 and 2 of this Act are forfeit to the State of South Dakota and, upon receipt, shall be deposited in the state general fund.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
